document_data.name: Flagon Held High
document_data.mainbody: The '''Flagon Held High''' was a tavern in [[Tilverton]] in the mid–14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Location: The Flagon was located in the eastern part of the [[Tilverton/Old Town|Old Town]] on the hilltop, towards the end of [[Phorn's Lane]].
document_data.Atmosphere: The Flagon was something of an ongoing festival, where people of all types came to meet, drink, and eat.
document_data.Services: The Flagon provided a wide selection of fine beers and fine entertainment, with professional joke-tellers, dancers, minstrels, escorts, and thieves working the patrons. Easy-going [[Purple Dragons]] watched the outgoing crowds each night, directing lost and befuddled customers back to their lodgings.
document_data.Structure: A fire around [[1367 DR]] resulted in the tavern being rebuilt and renovated, with the cellars supplied by a winch-tunnel that ran from [[Drakar Lane]] below the Old Town knoll.
